Hannah Steinberg is a fourth year at UCLA majoring in Cognitive Science and Statistics. 

Hannah's research background is in psycholinguistics, with a focus on cognitive control and noisy channel processing. 

Hannah's overall research interests are in the quantiative psychology world: in measurement and item response theory, with a focus on differential item functioning and measurement invariance.
